alert.note: Alert for Southwest Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 30 at 2:11PM MST until January 31 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 10 to 20 degrees below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Southwest Utah. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 10 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
